rComments: As a CS major, this course changed my fundamental understanding of solving problems on computers. We worked hard and we learned a lot. Andreas uses the scientific method to teach his courses. His ego concerning course materials was low, as far as my interactions went. I had some conversations about hw where we had to figure it out together.

His courses were straight forward, grading expectations were spelled out, and his scientific method approach to lectures has proven to be a valuable tool. He's always on the lookout to improve his course work. The only thing missing, when I took it, was the lack of live AV of his lectures for review; the lecture slides were available instead.

One of the kindest people I've ever met. An absolute gem of a teacher. He values his students, and he expects a high level of performance. One of the best teachers I've ever had. A true friend to his students and colleagues.
Hands down best professor at UCSC.

DiBlas was a really engaging professor. I found it pretty easy to follow along with the class material, even though the course material is complex. Tests are difficult, however, and require a high competency in doing complex math without calculators. Overall, though, DiBlas is a great professor and truly shows care in the success of his students.
Exams are very difficult, but the rest of the class is pretty simple. Very dense course. A lot of different subject matter covered.

Andreas is the man, he understands that it's better not to assign any programming projects in this class...I some what agree with the guy/gal below, he went over the important materials a lil bit too quick, but if you take time and look over the hw solutions you would learn, which is the TA's fault for not posting the HW on time, but Andrea is # 1
Pretty good.  Sometimes goes over hard material too quickly and spends too much time on useless stuff.  Tests and quizzes are pretty hard but not impossible.
Great teacher, does the same thing over and over again though. Expect lectures from slides and guest speakers, no projects.
Andrea has a sexy,sexy voice.

Great professor over all! The class is not easy, but it's definitely doable. His tests are a challenge, but if you know majority of the material well, you should be able to pass with no problems. I did fairly well in his class due to staying up with the class and going in for office hrs with ta's and Andrea, *hint hint they are helpful!!*

Great professor, wish I took him for ce12.  Knows his stuff and conveys it very clearly.  Still a difficult class though and not putting work into it will get you an F. Project was time consuming and didn't impact the grade that much, still fun to do though.  He had great TA's too.

Andrea has a great sense of humor and a true passion for teaching. His lectures can tend to get off topic, but they will always be fairly interesting and related to modern technology. Downside is that he tests very hard, with questions usually extremely different from the homework in order to truly test understanding.
Really great teacher. Very helpful and clear. Probably the best teacher in the whole CE department.

Andrea is an experience at the SOE... alternately witty and frustrating, you'll either love him or hate him. You can scoot by on minimal effort if you want (it isn't that hard - his TA's work *very* hard to make your life easier, more than most paid faculty will!), but you'll get more out of his classes if you really put a lot of effort in to them.

Andrea is a great teacher. He is very energetic which make a class very interactive. He also is very passionate. He also invited a few of nVIDIA, AMD and Intel top architects to give a talk in class. There are a bunch of cool assignments almost every week that make the class a busy one.

Andrea is a great teacher, he is passionate about what he teaches and his students. You will learn a lot in this class, and enjoy it at the same time. Andrea does require a lot of work, and for the most part it is useful, although I think with the project this should have a 1 or 2 unit lab with it. Andrea generally has good TA's

One of the best teachers I have ever had. He has an accent but it's rather easy to understand. He has a great sense of humor. His class requires a lot of work, but he provides a lot of help and you'll really learn something.

Lectures: Slow and uses real life examples where it is too complex and doesn't bring material together. Overall though, enthusiastic in teaching and makes clear points. Good lectures.  Homework: I felt like it was a lot of busy work than review of the material.  Project: Too many complaints about this one.  Only reviewed because he said sugge

Andrea is an awesome teacher. He moves quickly and demands a lot of work, but is very fair with his grading. He really knows his material, and keeps his lectures interesting. I'd recommend this teacher to anyone taking this class.

Regardless of my grade in this class, the thing I value most is that this class challenged me to work hard and push beyond my limitations. As a bonus, the Prof. often discussed real-world applications of the course topics.

Andrea teaches a challenging, but fun, class.  The lecture materials (lots and lots of slides) have plenty of original content.  In particular, I am impressed by the number and variety of diagrams he creates for lectures.  Also, the most memorable topic of this class was his restaurant analogy of the pipelined processor (which I still remember toda
This guy deserves a 0 in the clarity category. His inability to teach made this hard class even harder. Try to avoid him if you can

A disappointing class.  He had grad students grading and between the two of them could not get homework back to the students before critical exams..midterms (2).  The lab tutors were equally inept; I was lucky to get feedback on labs 3/4 through the quarter.  With so many people grading and TA'ing you'd think things would be done expeditiously?

di Blas is a talented lecturer, I found myself going to lectures even when I felt I had command of the subject matter, just because he is an entertaining speaker.  On the downside, however, he overclocks his tests, barely giving people time to write out the answers to test questions even if they have the material in mental cache.

Really good instructor, funny guy, a joy to be in class with.  Sort of looks like he could be a Dracula double, hes got the face and the accent, just needs the fangs.  The project in the class was absurd, though.  Designing a single cycle CPU sounds like fun, but doing it in MMLogic kills it.  Overall a great classroom experience.
not all teachers should be teaching and di blas is one of them, test are designed for upper division courses i guess he likes to see students suffer.

Absoluetly awsome professor.  Classes were interesting(I didn't fall asleep once!).  Very approachable, immensely helpful, and knowledgable.  Excelent in office hours.  The tests were unusual, but they tested not only that you knew the material, but if you could apply it to something in an unusual way.

Great guy, helpful and very knowledgable about the subject.  Tests are extreamly hard though and will cover everything/anything he has talked about so make sure to take notes or look at them online.  Labs were quite easy, very do-able in your assigned times without having to come in on your own much.  Overall - great teacher, hard class

Great guy, but his tests are really unfair. Of course, we're supposed to know the stuff, but he makes us do extra-deep-stare-at-the-question-until-time-runs-out questions for half of the test. The other half is pretty reasonable and doable. Prepare yourself for some stupid question that might dock you off 20 points or so...

Andrea was a pretty awesome teacher and listened to students' concerns.  Heck a couple of times he stopped by the labs to help us out.  The problem was that some of the test questions he gave were less of a "lets see what you've learned" and more of a "heh, lets see if you can figure out this puzzle".  It was interesting, but slightly off topic.

Andrea is a very good professor who explains all the topics in a clear and concise way. If a student does not understand a topic, he is available to provide all the help needed. One more thing. He and his TAs grade the homeworks, quizzes, and tests extremely fast. Example, it only took one day to receive the final grade after we took took the final

Very helpful, makes the material interesting, good at giving you a picture to work with instead of just talking about the material.  The class is NOT easy, so go to lecture and section religiously.  He's a European gentleman, so he's amazingly polite to the female students.
Really cool guy, even if he's a smelly european. :p. He's a great teacher and very helpful. Sorry ladies he's single.

Andrea is a really cool guy who cares a lot about the material he teaches. Seek help from him whenever you run into trouble because he'll never deny one-on-one time to students. His tests are hard but really cover what he taught in class...nothing new shows up in a test.

Good handouts and slides.  Lectures are organzied and easy to follow.  The material isn't that hard, homeworks range from easy to moderately difficult.  Quizes are hard, but the review sections cover almost exactly what's on the quiz.  Exams aren't that difficult if you're a CE major.

Class was pretty challenging overall. Make sure to do all the homeworks thoroughly and you'll be fine. Relied heavily on boring powerpoint presentations with information he only fills in during class, so often vital information is left out from the lecture slides online. Grading breakdown is by 15%.
very humorous in class. very helpful to students. Tells good jokes in class. You will learn a lot from his class and getting an A is very hard. I would take his class again.
cool professor, he tries to make his class alil bit more lively by telling jokes. 60% is a C, 70% is a B. its a huge curve, but his class is not easy.
He's such a cool Italian.  Class is a little slow, but it's fun to go to, just cuz Andrea's cool.

Andrea is a very fun professor to have a class from. He has an amazing command of the material, and his accent is fun rather than a hindrance. His assignments and tests can be quite difficult, but his grading is pretty fair. The only real complaint is that the project with the class was a bit extreme.

If u like to have a fast speaking Italian,  a lot of homeworks, projects, quizzes, then this teacher is for you. FOR A 5 units class, i work like 12 units class. The new homework helper, Gregory Jackson, is making this class harder with the words "you know it!" to answer your questions. I like your ce12 class Andrea,but this class u suck.

Andrea is easily my favorite engineering professor. He's funny and good-spirited. His lectures turned out to be worth going to for more than just the education. Andrea Di Blas is one of those rare professors who REALLY cares about teaching and about his subject matter. The result is an effective teacher who is good at teaching.

di blas is a pretty decent professor. as the quarter went on, less people came to lectures and more people went to sleep, but as long as you went to homework section, you could figure out what was going on. his slides go by really fast and it's hard to write down what he's got on there. very challenging, but also very rewarding. lc3 sucks.

Amazing professor.  I rarely found myself bored in lecture, as he's very animated, enthusiastic, and funny.  He's also very patient.  Even though the technology we learned about is far from cutting edge, he frequently explained how the concepts we were learning were currently being applied in the industry.  Labs, homework, and midterm were great.

Very funny professor. The labs are fun but at the same time really challenging, it would be cool if he would show more examples on how to do the labs. But besides that Andrea is a great professor! In the other hand my lab tutor wasn't that great but TAs were helpful!

Very enjoyable teacher. Did a good job at making material understandable, and was humorous too. Labs were fun, tests were challenging but reasonable.  He tells me Fall '08 will be his last time teaching CMPE12- if you're going to take CE12, take it now before it's too late!

he breaks down material pretty good and records the lectures to his website. the class isnt too bad. but andrea is kinda cocky and thinks he is way cooler than he actually is. he is pretty stern in office hours and i would suggest taking this class with a teacher that you have had before. he is extremely anal about cheating and will accuse of it
My favorite professor thus far. I already knew class material so the class was a breeze, but even if I hadn't most people agreed he was an excellent and thorough teacher.

Actually my favorite professor at UCSC. I had a good time in his class and learned a lot. He's a funny guy and very clear in his lectures. I got into a bit of trouble in his class over a mixup, but he was very fair and reasonable and the problem sorted itself out quickly and easily. I will prefer Andrea's classes over other professors' from now on.

Parallel processing was challenging especially Mandlebrot.Some of the assignments were difficult especially Mandlebrot and felt like giving up, but Andrea pushed me to do my best and not give up. He helped me out even when there were no office hours. He is a funny professor and I will T.A. for him anytime.

Andrea rocks! He's enthusiastic, knows his stuff, and actually knows HOW TO TEACH! Tests were challenging but very fair. Gives back points if the majority of students don't get a certain problem. Labs were a challenge but an excellent way to really learn the material. You will learn a ton in his class and have fun at the same time. A++!

Prof. records his lectures in video /w audio.  That was very beneficial.  Whenever, i am unclear about some material from class, i can go back, and listen to that part of the video/audio and work it out for myself. Professor Di Blas is extremely passionate about teach and the subject itself.  He is a funny guy, and kept me interested!

Very helpful and interesting.  Made the class and subject fun.  His tests were hard but fair, and he was willing to give back points on questions a lot of people missed.  I wish the comments he wrote about us were a little more personal though.

Excellent lectures with lots of examples.  He is very knowledgeable on the material and gives fair homework. The lab portion of the class is extremely intense but rewarding.  His tests are thorough and demanding.  He is a perfect engineering professor.

Andrea is great.  Though his tests can be a little difficult, he's fair in his grading and makes sure you know the material. In class he's funny and engaging, which is refreshing in comparison to the sometimes dry material. Good professor, good course, nothing else to say.

This class was quite hard in the fact that the concepts are just kinda out there at first. Then they make total sense later, much later. Labs suck! Staying up all night to finish labs every week. So be prepared to be a loner,and you'll find tons of nerds in this class. Hes a good teacher, generous in office hours, makes effort to clarify things.

Andrea is an extremely competent teacher. I learned a lot from his class, and feel it was one of the best classes I have taken here. When I took the class (W07) the TA was miserable but the lab tutor was amazing. The tests are hard, but reasonable and the labs are the real meat of the class, so prepare to spend some time there. Overall very good.
Really nice guy. His class was difficult to say the least, but after all was said and done I learned a lot. Tests are brutal so find a study group. Over all I'd highly recommend him.
Really nice guy. His class was difficult to say the least, but after all was said and done I learned a lot. Tests are brutal so find a study group. Over all I'd highly recommend him.
